COMPANY: Stilman Advanced Strategies
POSITION: Senior Front End Developer
LOCATION: Denver, CO Headquarters. Remote- work from home, anywhere USA is fine. Additional ideal cities to Denver, CO are the Washington, DC area and Orlando FL.
US Citizenship is required. This position requires the ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance during early employment which we sponsor.

Company Overview
STILMAN Advanced Strategies develops software based on Linguistic Geometry (LG), a unique Artificial Intelligence (AI) approach. Our core technology generates predictive, tactically correct Courses of Action (COAs) that dynamically adapt in response to changes in missions and actions taken by the intelligent opposition. These tools support mission planning, rehearsal, training and execution use cases for military commanders across echelons and services. Our applications have been shown to deliver unique value to the warfighter due to the quality of generated COAs, UX/UI design that makes it easy to fully comprehend complex COA results and to define mission inputs, as well as ease of deployment and integration with other system with well-defined modern APIs.

Our small, distributed team has been developing and continually improving these software applications since 1999. We pride ourselves on the quality of our software and we are excited as we continue this development with US Navy, US Army, Missile Defense Agency (MDA) and other agencies to further enhance, integrate, and deploy these products.

The Role: Senior Front-End Developer
We are looking to bring on one or more additional Senior Frontend developers to work on the primary user interface - web app that leverages modern UI technologies, UX concepts, GIS/mapping, communications protocols, data formats, and military concepts. This web app encompasses a large feature set for map-centric scenario construction and editing, 2D and 3D animated visualization, real time collaboration, analytics, integration with other UI and backend systems. Yet we make sure that the user experience for both basic and advanced users is as smooth as possible, little training is needed, and the officers can intuitively use the tool to help them think about tactics rather than spending their time thinking about how to use the tool.
You will take part in design of new UI/UX for new features or redesigning existing ones based on customer needs and feedback, implementation of front end software using Angular, Bootstrap, Leaflet, and Cesium, performance optimization, work with backend COA-generation software developers on APIs, data representation and protocols, help model military concepts in software, as well as work with 3rd party software developers to find best ways to integrate our systems.

Key Experience to Have
JavaScript, HTML, CSS
Angular & AngularJS
Bootstrap SCSS
Performance Optimization
Data Structures and Algorithms


Great Experience to Have
Modeling & Simulation
GIS & Mapping
Mercurial, Git, SVN
CI/CD, Jenkins, Selenium
Docker and Kubernetes
Java, C++ and other languages
AngularUI Bootstrap
Leaflet
Cesium
Grunt
SVGs
Jsonix
Browser Compatibility
Font Awesome
Military concepts and tactics
The Team
We are a small team that's distributed throughout United States and work 100% remote, with some possible travel to customer sites. The software developers are self-motivated and able to work independently, but collaborate closely with each other to take advantage of each other's strength and help where help is needed. All aspects of our work are collaborative rather than stove piped into narrowly defined roles.

Benefits & Other
We offer an attractive compensation package including competitive salaries, bonuses, medical and dental coverage, flexible schedule & PTO, and tuition assistance. US Citizenship is required. This position requires the ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance. This is a full time employee hire to Stilman, working in partnership with Talent Architect Rick Powell, Fractional Recruiter. We fly under the radar on social media but will be glad to share more information with you once we are in discussions. Thanks for considering Stilman Advanced Strategies for your next career move!

Who We Are:

We are a group of self-starters who’ve developed one of the most powerful analytics platforms for tracking sponsorship ROI, media-value exposure, and audience behavioral shifts. We are a rapidly growing SaaS company with a client roster that includes over 200 esports and sports teams, brands, and agencies.

Who Are We Looking For (We Hope It's You):


We are looking for a Senior .NET Engineer with a passion for solving coding, machine learning / AI and automation challenges.

You’re a great fit if…


You have a passion for designing, building and maintaining high-quality software that answers the demands of a growing business
You enjoy solving challenging problems and good knowledge of DevOps tools.
You want to work in a fast-paced but fun startup environment with a tight-knit and talented team


What You'll Do @Zoomph (Code Away):


4+ years of experience working with .NET Framework / Core (C# and .NET)
Experience using JavaScript libraries and frameworks such as Node.js, AngularJS, KnockoutJS, BackboneJS, and ReactJS
Experience building APIs and background services leveraging cloud providers i.e. Amazon Web Services or Azure
Experience working with SQL and relational databases

Responsibilities for this Position:
Help make the technologies, products and services that make a difference. That’s the opportunity that’s waiting for you at General Dynamics Mission Systems. We help our nation’s heroes keep our nation safe by creating solutions so advanced, they redefine innovation for the world. It’s an amazing challenge. And it’s waiting for you now.


We apply advanced technologies such as Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, AR/VR, Cloud Native and Quantum Physics to solve our customers’ missions in cyber, RF, undersea, interstellar space and everything in between.

As a Senior Software Engineer, you’ll perform software requirements analysis, participate in research and design, and develop and test software and tools. From inventing new products or enhancing existing applications, your talent will be front and center.

The Center for Cancer Research (CCR), part of the intramural program in the National Cancer Institute (NCI) is seeking to fill a Senior Clinician (HS) position in the Molecular Imaging Program (MIP) with an outstanding radiologist with research experience and expertise in magnetic resonance imaging (MRI), position emission tomography (PET) and artificial intelligence (AI).
The goal of the MIP is to develop targeted imaging methods that accelerate cancer therapies. The MIP is focused on the development and translation of in vivo molecular imaging and MRI for early detection, monitoring, and therapy. Having invested substantially in equipment and personnel, the MIP is well positioned to address challenges that the field of molecular imaging faces.
The Senior Clinician will have available resources including funding for clinical trials, nurse practitioners, research nurses, and patient care coordinators. In addition, the senior clinician will have access to a robust clinical trials infrastructure including data management, training, protocol support office, regulatory support, information systems and technology, and data safety monitoring. Dedicated human imaging equipment for research includes a 3T MRI and PET/CT scanner. The CCR’s collaborative culture also offers research staff access to a wide array of intellectual and technological assets, including high-quality technology cores dedicated to radiochemistry, genomics, bioinformatics/biostatistics, and artificial intelligence. For an overview of CCR, please visit http://ccr.cancer.gov/.
CCR is working to solve the most pressing problems in the field through basic, translational and clinical cancer research to create the cancer medicines of tomorrow and is dedicated to preparing the next generation of cancer researchers. Read more about CCR, the benefits of working at CCR and hear from our staff on their CCR experiences.
The CCR is a unique place of science where we combine diverse expertise with the freedom to thoroughly pursue the most pressing questions in cancer biology and treatment. The CCR is home to an extraordinary group of scientists and clinicians exploring the cutting-edge of cancer and HIV/AIDS research. Our scientists work on a wide spectrum of biological and biomedical problems enjoying complete intellectual freedom and are expected to creatively and innovatively explore the most important questions in the field of cancer research and treatment. We support projects over a long-time horizon allowing our investigators to pursue some of the most difficult, high-risk problems in the field, offering a wide array of intellectual and technological and research resources.

Number of Positions:
1
C.V. Required:
Yes
Number of References Required:
0
Experience Required:
The Senior Clinician position is the equivalent to an Associate or Full Professor in Academia. In addition to having outstanding clinical skills, the incumbent will be expected to develop and manage complex clinical programs, provide oversight of a large clinical trial portfolio of treatment and natural history studies, oversee diverse clinical support teams, and foster collaborations with principal investigators within disease-specific focus areas. The successful candidate will be expected to manage a multidisciplinary clinical research team. Applicants must have a M.D. or equivalent medical degree and have substantial patient care, research, managerial, and mentoring experience.

Additional Information:
Bethesda, located adjacent to Washington, D.C., is an urban core of Montgomery County, MD. Bethesda is one of the most affluent and highly educated communities in the United States. Living in Bethesda offers residents a suburban feel with a lot of restaurants, coffee shops, and parks. The public schools in Bethesda are highly rated. The NIH Clinical Center is the world’s largest research hospital which offers state-of-the-art facilities, collaborative opportunities, and core facilities for advanced technologies. This position is subject to a background investigation.

How To Apply:
Interested applicants should submit:
A statement of research interests (1-2 pages)A current curriculum vitae and complete bibliography (Please include in your CV, a description of your mentoring and outreach activities, especially those involving women and persons from racial/ethnic and other groups that are underrepresented in biomedical research.)
Applications must be submitted electronically to https://service.cancer.gov/ccr-careers?id=ccr_careers_public_home. Review of applications will begin on or about July 20, 2020. Applications will be treated as confidential.

Contact Name:
Lori Holliday

hollidal@mail.nih.gov

Janssen develops treatments that improve the health and lifestyles of people worldwide. Research and Development areas encompass Oncology, Cardiovascular and Metabolic disorders, Immunology, Neuroscience, and Infectious diseases. Our ultimate goal is to help people live longer, healthier lives. We have produced and marketed many first-in-class prescription medications and are poised to serve the broad needs of the healthcare market – from patients to practitioners and from clinics to hospitals. 8+ years of experience in the Data Science and /or Digital Health space in a company ranging from start-ups to consulting firms with established Data Science practices or large Fortune 500 companies.
Experience in product management and leadership experience to design and execute on high impact data science projects / platforms
Proven project leadership in complicated context, able to influence and engage the strategic and technical partners
Proven track record of partnership and leading in a matrix organization
Excellent communication, interpersonal, and written skills.
Preferred:
Familiarity with drug discovery and clinical development processes.
Experience delivering on data science projects using predictive technologies, data mining and/or text mining.
Managing of healthcare relevant datasets, such as EHR, insurance claims or registry data.
Experience with visualization software/tools such as R, Spotfire, Tableau, etc.

job_description:
Senior Software Engineering Manager - Minneapolis, MN-200010517

At U.S. Bank, we're passionate about helping customers and the communities where we live and work. The fifth-largest bank in the United States, we’re one of the country's most respected, innovative and successful financial institutions. U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors.

U.S. Bank is seeking a Senior Software Engineering Manager for our Digital Banking Platform (mobile and online banking) with design and development experience to contribute toward the success of our technology initiatives. He/she will be responsible for development and support of the artificial intelligence engine within the digital banking applications.

You will be responsible for architecting and implementing high performing mobile applications on iOS and/or Android. We are super serious about application performance, complex and engaging UI and integrated experience across multiple applications. You'll work closely with the engineers on your team as well Product, Design, QA and other partner teams to deliver well-engineered experiences that delight our customers.


The overall team is a combination of employees, contractors, and off shore developers. This position will include application design, development oversight, and coordination with other groups within the bank to deliver the overall solution. You will own release schedules in our fast-paced environment, and work closely with software engineers, QA, product managers and field testers to get high-quality products and new features built, tested, and released on time. You will coordinate lots of fast-changing, moving parts and still get them to come together as a product. You'll need excellent communication skills to be the go-to person for all questions about release schedules, quality and progress updates.


Key Responsibilities

Manage technical projects or programs, working closely with product managers, engineers and technical staff to develop and track release milestones and schedules for the many moving parts that need to come together.
Develop a plan and schedule with well-defined milestones.
Manage communication of progress/status within the core team and external to the team; escalate issues as necessary.
Assess the quality of releases through monitoring of incoming bugs and code changes to identify quality issues and trends.
Develop tools and processes to improve software engineering productivity.


Successful applicants will exemplify US Bank's ethical principles of uncompromising integrity, respect for others, accountability for decisions and actions, and good citizenship.


Leaders at U.S. Bank consistently demonstrate integrity and ethics, maturity and resilience, and inspire trust and confidence among their teams. Our leaders are strong communicators who promote collaborative relationships, influence others, and value the diversity of backgrounds and ideas among their employees

Hands on experience developing native IOS, Android or web applicationsFive or more years of managerial experienceExperience managing a front end development teamStrong understanding on mobile design principles, patterns and best practices

Proven experience in both small and medium size teams

Strong collaboration skills with peers
Good development background

Excellent communication skills written and verbal

Experience with HTML/JS / ReactNative is a strong plus
Experience with Git, Scrum, Kanban

In 2019 we tripled the size of our Product & Engineering team, and are searching for creative and inspiring colleagues at all levels of the engineering organization to join us as we continue to expand in 2020.

About This Role:

In this role, you will work with a group of engineers and analysts to build the Compass data platform. Our team's mission is to envision, build and deploy the next generation end-to-end platform for data ingestion, processing, storage, scheduling and analysis at massive scale to provide leverage for Compass. Every team at Compass—product, engineering, finance, operations, people and culture and leadership rely on our platform to make data-informed decisions as well as power the business with data.

Responsibilities:

Work closely with key internal business stakeholders to understand user needs with data, identify gaps in our offerings and form product requirements

Set ambitious goals, and measure and quantify impact on a regular basis
Champion and build a culture of data informed decision making

Bachelor's degree in an analytical field (Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics or related field)
5+ years of product management or related experience for data products
Proven ability to lead teams and work cross-functionally with technical and non-technical team members
Familiarity with big data technologies (such as Kafka, Hadoop, Spark and Redshift), relational databases and data products generally
Experience with developer tools and platforms (Github, AWS, Airflow) a plus
Experience with business intelligence tools such as Looker or Tableau is a plus
Ability to thrive and adapt in a fast-paced, high-growth and rapidly changing environment

At Compass, our mission is to help everyone find their place in the world. This means we continually celebrate the diverse community different individuals cultivate. As an equal opportunity employer, we stay true to our mission by ensuring that our place can be anyone's place.

What You’ll Do
Building best in class cognitive engines by leveraging advanced algorithms performing comprehensive analysis in near real-time.

job_title_2: Senior Signal Processing Engineer II - RF/EO/IR Algorithms, Models and Analysis (SPC)
job_description:
Are you a senior-level professional who wants to develop Signal Processing solutions to solve complex problems for Radar and/or Electro-Optical/Infrared (EO/IR) missile applications?
Do you have a passion for developing models and algorithms, integrating them into computer simulations, and then performing analysis of the results?
Do you enjoy leading dynamic teams where you share your knowledge and learn?
If your answers are yes, the Signal Processing (SP) teams at Raytheon Missiles & Defense (RMD) may have an ideal job for you! The Tucson, AZ, facility is searching for several Senior Signal Processing Engineers to join a growing team of engineering professionals who share a mission of protecting our war fighters and allies.

The System Design & Performance (SD&P) Directorate is responsible for Signal Processing (SP), Systems Design (SD), Guidance, Navigation and Control (GNC), and Modeling, Simulation and Analysis (MSA) for RMD's broad portfolio of projects, programs and products. Signal Processing has the responsibility to design and develop Radar and EO/IR models and algorithms, conduct system trades/sensitivity analyses and conduct performance assessments to support RMD products and new business initiatives.Our teams’ engineers are versatile, eager to learn, innovative, and self-motivated. Learn more and apply today!

U.S. Citizenship status is required as this position needs an active U.S. Security Clearance as of day one of employment.

Job Description and Key Tasks:
Working in detailed high fidelity simulations written in C/C++ and MATLAB to develop, prototype, and test radar and/or EO/IR signal processing algorithms and sensor models
Conducting performance trade-off and sensitivity analysis for missile radar and/or EO/IR sensor applications
Working in production and engineering lab test environments and field test environments to test, verify, and validate radar and/or EO/IR sensor models and signal processing algorithm requirements and performance
Working in a team environment in all phases of missile development from program start up to live fire test, to provide engineering support by participating in project design reviews and peer reviews, including technical briefings to internal leadership and external customers
Lead technical team and/or manage an engineering project and also mentor engineers

Required Education, Experience & Skills:

Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering, Electrical and Computer Engineering, Optical Engineering, Computer Science, Physics, Math or related STEM degree
Ten (10) years of applied work experience in the following areas (Masters with 8 years of experience, or Ph.D. with 6 years of experience):
Experience in radar and/or EO/IR sensor signal processing algorithm and model development and analysis
Programming in a compiled language such as C++ (preferred), C, Java, or Python
Experience using tools such as MATLAB or Python for analysis of data sets
Experience using UNIX/Linux based workstations
Experience with running and modifying simulations and performing analysis
Experience developing and presenting technical briefings
Four (4) years of leadership experience managing others as a technical lead, team lead or similar lead role involving applied system engineering and analysis and interfacing with multiple engineering disciplines
U.S. citizenship is required
Must be willing to relocate to Tucson, AZ (comprehensive relocation package available)

Desired Education, Skills and Experience:
ABET is the preferred, although not required, accreditation standard
Advanced Degree in Electrical Engineering, Electrical and Computer Engineering, Optical Engineering, Computer Science, Physics, Math or related STEM degree
Experience with missile components and systems
Experience with hardware/software integration
Ability to work well in teams and independently
Good communication, interpersonal, planning and time management skills
Course work or experience in some of the following fields: radar & image signal processing, digital communications, probability and statistics, linear algebra, artificial intelligence, machine learning, and signals & systems
Experience in autonomous and collaborative systems
Current/Active DoD SSBI

Description:
This is a new role in a new organization, Scientific and Digital Innovation, whose global responsibilities are to drive new business and scientific solutions to meet Sanofi Pasteur’s mission to become the disruptive market leader in vaccines.
S/he will apply their solid mathematical / analytical skills to model scientific and business challenges, propose solutions, and role model quantitative thinking. S/he will develop and apply models across many types of learning tasks: from natural language processing for sentiment analysis, to reinforcement learning tasks (delayed reward and credit assignment), to high-dimensional regression for optimum design, and structured prediction for portfolio analytics.
S/he will have an advanced mastery and practical experience with developing and applying complex machine learning and similar modeling solutions. S/he will have had hands-on experience covering advanced algorithms, databases, networking, modeling and simulation, as well as those covering biocomputation and bioengineering informatics, as well as essential scientific programming skills (e.g. in languages such as Python/R and the like).
S/he will have an advanced mastery of numerical methods in both theory and practice for convex (at minimum) and nonconvex optimization (ideally). S/he will have an advanced understanding of common data-parallel and NUMA optimization algorithm transformation.
S/he will work in a centralized team of scientific and business experts and is expected to blend lateral influence with direct action.
S/he is expected to have a solid background in mathematics and/or machine learning regardless of education level achieved.
Responsibilities:
Machine Learning (ML) and Digital Solutions
Brings unconventional ideas from idea to Proof-of-Concept (POC), especially by combining machine learning techniques with laboratory approaches, and helps drive projects through to completion or to the clinic.
Challenges existing models and dogma by developing and/or identifying experiments to couple clinical outcomes to preclinical assessments
Develops and deploys contemporary and state-of-the-art machine learning platforms (e.g. deep learning platforms like Tensorflow/MXNet and the like)
Develops, deploys, and assesses the results of at-scale models at varying levels of model granularity for characterizing the biochemical, cellular, organ, and systems-level properties of vaccination, encompassing heterogeneous preclinical and clinical data.
Designs and performs computational experiments with a ‘fail fast’ spirit and considers the outlier result the most interesting result.
Produces model designs and performs computational experiments with a ‘fail fast’ spirit and considers the outlier result the most interesting result.
Generates IP and participate in the drafting of patent filings
Directs the production of high-quality analyses and codebases that extend the capabilities and impact of the team as a whole
Internal and External Networking
Participates in relevant Project Teams and proactively maintain an open interface and communication channel with relevant areas of the company.
Ensures transparent and cooperative liaison with other positions around innovation and artificial intelligence/big data within the wider Sanofi Group.
Ensures efficient and agile communication of key information, process and workflow operational element in various circumstances.
Develops and maintains an international network of experts in CSB/ML, key science, technology and innovation areas, including outside the typical vaccine industry.
Representations and interventions at the international/community level on relevant ML and infectious disease matters. Presents at conferences.
Leads by Influence to mentor diverse staff in the interpretation and generation of novel vaccine candidates performance data

Education:
Bachelor's Degree in Machine Learning, Applied Math, Statistics, Computer Science, or a Computational Science field; or Master's Degree
Significant work and/or research experience

job_title_2: Sr. Consultant - Business Performance Analytics - Marketing Analytics
job_description:
Company Information
Solid reputation, passionate people and endless opportunities. That’s Travelers. Our superior financial strength and consistent record of strong operating returns mean security for our customers – and opportunities for our employees. You will find Travelers to be full of energy and a workplace in which you truly can make a difference.
Target Openings
1
Job Description Summary
Travelers is seeking an Senior Consultant Marketing Analytics practitioner to measure awareness with target audiences, engagement with valuable content, and preference for Travelers’ products.

The senior marketing analytics consultant is responsible for supporting measurement efforts specific to enterprise digital marketing across multiple channels including paid media, search engine optimization, websites, landing pages, display, search, mobile, social, email, quotes and sales. The consultant will be part of Traveler’s cutting-edge effort to understand the impact of marketing by creating dashboards (e.g. Datorama, Tableau, Qlikview) and providing business insights to all levels of management. In this position, the senior consultant would measure digital marketing performance against goals and leverage key performance indicators (KPIs) to tell a story to the relevant audience. The candidate is responsible for regularly partnering with other teams to prepare data driven insights using common metrics used by digital media and advertising industry. In addition, the consultant would evaluate data to put together presentations to measure performance of various marketing channels (including but not limited to paid social media, native advertising, paid search, and partnerships). The consultant would actively contribute towards the Enterprise Digital Marketing analytics team best reporting practices for social networks including LinkedIn, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and Pinterest.

The senior consultant may be occasionally asked to use statistical, machine learning and/or artificial intelligence modeling to understand impact of media on social and other channels where direct measurement is not possible. The consultant would use his passion for interpreting data as well as intellectual curiosity to apply new techniques to dive deep into quantifying the impact of marketing on both business and consumers.
Primary Job Duties & Responsibilities
Uses analytics to explain marketing results, monitor marketing strategies and identify actionable opportunities.
Works with media and marketing team across enterprise with BI, PI, Bond, IT and/or other data management teams to provide analysis and insights.
Uses data visualization and storytelling skills to effectively communicate insights and help influence decision/outcomes.
With some direction, leverages industry best practices, market data and technology trends to identify business opportunities.
Effectively works with cross functional teams on varying business initiatives
Provides information that can help influence business strategy and help to prioritize investments based on translating insights to business value.
Collaborates with IT and data management teams to ensure correct data is persisted for business critical analysis.
Collaborates with IT, Actuarial, Operations, Finance, Data Management and Claim functional areas.
Can manipulate raw data and work towards the ultimate design required to meet business requests.
Interprets data to recognize patterns and analyze trends.
Completes reasonability and validation tests with direction.
Supports Proofs of Concept to inform business strategies.
Monitors performance indicators and identifies possible improvements.
Supports assessment of the financial impact of recommendations.
Minimum Qualifications
Two years of business analytics experience required.
Education, Work Experience, & Knowledge
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Business (with Quantitative focus), Marketing or related discipline preferred. Master’s degree desirable.
3+ years of analytics or related experience preferred.
3+ years working successfully with Microsoft office products or similar products preferred.
Advanced knowledge of MS Excel essential (e.g. Pivot tables, etc).
1+ years of digital marketing experience a plus.
Job Specific Technical Skills & Competencies
Exposure and working knowledge of tools such as Python, SAS, R, SQL preferred.
Knowledge or wiliness to learn modeling and marketing metrics a plus.
Demonstrated intermediate analytic and diagnostic skills.
Intermediate problem solving and decision making skills.
Experience with Descriptive Analytic practices and processes preferred.
General knowledge of digital marketing metrics (Engagement Rate, CTR, CPC) preferred.
Knowledge or experience of dashboarding tools, KPI, etc.
Previous experience with web analytics reporting applications (IBM Digital Analytics (formerly Core metrics), Google Analytics, etc.) preferred.
General understanding of the business functions, processes, and overall business strategies.
Developing knowledge of insurance products/concepts preferred.
Intermediate ability to work independently and as part of a team.
General knowledge of the main features of the collection of data and the relationship of data.
Ability to effectively communicate with business partners, manage time and projects.
Demonstrated ability to analyze and communicate findings in non-technical terms preferred.
Excellent time management skills, and collaborative nature preferred.
Ability to evaluate results and provide insights.
Intermediate project management skills.
Intermediate ability to see tasks to completion.

COMPANY: Stilman Advanced Strategies
POSITION: Senior Front End Developer
LOCATION: Remote- work from home, anywhere USA is fine. Ideal cities to Denver, CO (HQ) are the Washington, DC area and Orlando FL.
US Citizenship is required. This position requires the ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance during early employment which we sponsor.

Company Overview
STILMAN Advanced Strategies develops software based on Linguistic Geometry (LG), a unique Artificial Intelligence (AI) approach. Our core technology generates predictive, tactically correct Courses of Action (COAs) that dynamically adapt in response to changes in missions and actions taken by the intelligent opposition. These tools support mission planning, rehearsal, training and execution use cases for military commanders across echelons and services. Our applications have been shown to deliver unique value to the warfighter due to the quality of generated COAs, UX/UI design that makes it easy to fully comprehend complex COA results and to define mission inputs, as well as ease of deployment and integration with other system with well-defined modern APIs.

Our small, distributed team has been developing and continually improving these software applications since 1999. We pride ourselves on the quality of our software and we are excited as we continue this development with US Navy, US Army, Missile Defense Agency (MDA) and other agencies to further enhance, integrate, and deploy these products.

The Role: Senior Front-End Developer
We are looking to bring on one or more additional Senior Frontend Developers to work on the primary user interface - web app that leverages modern UI technologies, UX concepts, GIS/mapping, communications protocols, data formats, and military concepts. This web app encompasses a large feature set for map-centric scenario construction and editing, 2D and 3D animated visualization, real time collaboration, analytics, integration with other UI and backend systems. Yet we make sure that the user experience for both basic and advanced users is as smooth as possible, little training is needed, and the officers can intuitively use the tool to help them think about tactics rather than spending their time thinking about how to use the tool.
You will take part in design of new UI/UX for new features or redesigning existing ones based on customer needs and feedback, implementation of front end software using Angular, Bootstrap, Leaflet, and Cesium, performance optimization, work with backend COA-generation software developers on APIs, data representation and protocols, help model military concepts in software, as well as work with 3rd party software developers to find best ways to integrate our systems.

Key Experience to Have
JavaScript, HTML, CSS
Angular & AngularJS

Performance Optimization
Data Structures and Algorithms

Military concepts and tactics
The Team
We are a small team that's distributed throughout United States and work 100% remote, with some possible travel to customer sites. The software developers are self-motivated and able to work independently, but collaborate closely with each other to take advantage of each other's strength and help where help is needed. All aspects of our work are collaborative rather than stove piped into narrowly defined roles.

Benefits & Other
We offer an attractive compensation package including competitive salaries, bonuses, medical and dental coverage, flexible schedule & PTO, and tuition assistance. US Citizenship is required. This position requires the ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance. This is a full time employee hire to Stilman, working in partnership with Talent Architect Rick Powell, Fractional Recruiter. We fly under the radar on social media but will be glad to share more information with you once we are in discussions. Thanks for considering Stilman Advanced Strategies for your next career move!

LivePerson is a transformational force in how brands and consumers communicate. With over 18,000 brands, including Citi, HSBC, Disney, Verizon, and Home Depot, we are on a mission to make life easier for people and brands everywhere through trusted Conversational AI. We believe in a future where conversations are the norm for getting your intentions fulfilled - whatever they are.

We are an innovative, intent-driven company that believes in building the future and we are looking for growth minded, unconventional thinkers, developers and builders to join the team.

You will thrive here if:
You can operate in a fast paced, dynamic environment

You can advance the SOTA in dialogue systems with experiments and code that are well-designed and well-implemented.

You can build partnerships that move our business forward

You see feedback or failure as motivation to learn and to grow

You believe data-driven decision making is the norm

You relate to our core principles (link) and want to work with Conversational AI experts


In this role, you will work with one of the world's largest goal-oriented conversational data sets to push the boundaries of computational linguistics and drive innovative new products at scale. In addition to a world-class data set, you'll also have an at-scale population of expert data annotators (contact center agents) to help drive investigation and learning.

In this role you will:
Propose and execute research efforts that drive product strategy
Publish and present cutting-edge research derived from our conversational data
Apply cutting-edge methods of NLP/NLU to learn and derive value from one of the world's largest goal-oriented conversational data sets.
Develop state of the art approaches to unsupervised/semi-supervised problems in intent and dialog management.
Some areas of research of particular interest:
Learning NLP systems using self-supervision from unannotated dialogue - Leveraging latent structure within task-oriented dialogue data to solve classification and dialogue problems more accurately and label-efficiently.
Faceted unsupervised learning - how can we inject knowledge into unsupervised tasks? How can we inject knowledge into clustering/similarity tasks to reflect facets we care about (intent) and orthogonalize irrelevant facets?
Lightly/distantly supervised dialog management ML systems - How can we utilize self-supervision and reinforcement learning to learn representations of conversational goals and policies from unlabelled historical conversations in a goal-oriented setting?
Controllable natural language generation - How can we build adaptable natural language generation systems that can be easily controlled/configured?
Requirements:
D. in Computational Linguistics, Computer Science, Statistics, or Mathematics
3-5 years post-graduate experience in ML, specifically in NLU/NLP
Expertise in NLP techniques to solve problems in dialogue management: either direct experience in dialogue systems OR experience in reinforcement learning
Track record of applied research on NLP or related fields, e.g. NLU, NLG, ASR/TTS and/or experience with dialogue systems
Writing Python code that is efficient and clean in a Linux environment
Experience with Python packages for Machine Learning (Scikit-Learn), NLP (SpaCy), and Deep Learning (Pytorch)
Proven track record of problem-solving, communication, and critical-thinking skills
Demonstrated capacity to work closely with teammates in a highly collaborative environment, as well as providing strong individual contributions
Preferred qualifications:
Record of publications in competitive journals/conferences in the field, such as EMNLP, ACL, ICLR, NIPS, NAACL.


Why you'll love working here:

LivePerson was named to Fast Company's World's most innovative companies of 2020 list for the Artificial Intelligence category. We offer top tier tech & data science colleagues, along with opportunities to push your own limits. We embrace invention and experimentation. You'll have great benefits, flexible time off, plus snacks and drinks to keep your mind fresh and stomach full. Most importantly, you'll have an ability to make an impact at work and at brands across the globe as we build the future with trusted Conversational AI together.

At LivePerson, people from diverse backgrounds come together to do their best work and be their authentic selves. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

The Intelligent Retail Lab is part of Walmart's Store No 8, an innovation hub formed by the world's largest retailer focused on identifying and investing in trends and technologies reshaping the shopping experience. Job Title: Lead Solutions Architect
Job Location: Camden, NJ
Job Description:
L3Harris Technologies– C5S is a recognized global leader in the design, development and production of secure communication systems and products supporting mission-critical space, ground, air and naval operations. C5S is where employees have the opportunity to make a significant impact on our business and the world around us while thriving in an environment that continually fosters growth and career development. We are committed to providing best-in-class solutions to our customers with the highest level of integrity, excellence and uncompromised quality in everything we do.
 The Lead Solutions Architect for Cyber Systems will be a leader in our fast-paced growing environment supporting new business capture by developing innovative Cyber solutions. S/he will be responsible for significant customer interactions teamed with a Solution Manager to help uncover and develop best-in-class solutions to meet their needs. Additionally, the Solutions Architect will be responsible for defining and driving the technical direction of prospective business opportunities, developing system architectures, providing leadership for proposals and strategic pursuits, as well as having significant input to shape the investments of the business. The Solutions Architect will also assess market level technology trends as well as capabilities of complementary solutions enabling larger scale solution offerings. The Solutions Architect will have all the necessary support, scope and resources, to have a direct impact on the growth of our business.
Essential Functions:
The Solutions Architect is an ideal position for someone who is a self-starter that will seize and maintain the initiative in ambiguous situations. The successful candidate will possess a fiercely competitive spirit with a relentless desire to impact and win. S/he has an affinity to challenge the status quo and propose new and innovative solutions to the most complex challenges.
Additionally, the successful candidate will possess:
Leadership experience with Systems Engineering and Model Based Systems Engineering
Exceptional leadership skills including the ability to make strategic and tactical decisions
Experience working closely with customers to identify solutions
Experience in developing and executing strategic technology roadmaps to develop new business opportunities
Experience working with Capture Management and Business Development to be the liaison between new customer program capture and Engineering
Proven ability to lead teams to develop Cyber system architectures of varying complexity
Excellent verbal and written communications skills; works with others to coordinate efforts, resolve cross-team issues and effectively communicate changes
Demonstrated experience in leading a team to design and integrate Cyber Systems
Demonstrated experience leading the design and integration of Key Management Systems including Electronic Key Management System (EKMS) and Key Management Infrastructure (KMI)
Experience with cloud-based computing solutions such as AWS and IC ITE
Experience with migrating applications to Cloud environments
Demonstrated experience in system design, integration and hardening of communication, networks and Sensor Systems
A Bachelors Degree in an engineering discipline, Masters degree desired
At least 8+ years of experience in Systems Engineering/Architect position on Cyber and /or Space programs
Qualifications:
Willingness to travel up to 25% of time
US Government Secret security clearance or ability to obtain clearance required. Active Security Clearance preferred
US Citizenship required
Preferred Additional Skills:
RF Design and Architecture experience is a plus
Experience with emerging 5G technologies, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning and Modeling/Simulation is a plus

Decisive Analytics a WBB Company has a Senior Software Engineer opening in Arlington, VA.

In this role you will lead the development of state of the art machine learning systems and help lead the transition of these technologies to our government customers.

Must be a US Citizen to be eligible to obtain a DoD security clearance

Over 3 years of experience in full stack software development

Experience developing machine learning algorithms in Python or Java.

Working knowledge of version control systems such as Git and bug tracking tools such as JIRA
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Strong team player who can effectively contribute to project development

Experience with JakartaEE, Wildfly/Thorntail, Flask/Bottle, Angular
Experience with Hadoop/Spark, Accumulo, MongoDB, Postgres
Experience with DoD or Intelligence Community (IC) programs

WORK LOCATION: Crystal City, VA
TRAVEL: 10%
KEY WORDS: Machine learning, artificial intelligence, python, java

job_description:

About Nauto

NautoⓇ is the only real-time AI-powered, Driver Behavior Learning Platform to predict, actively prevent, and reduce high-risk events in the mobility ecosystem. By analyzing billions of data points from over 400 million AI-processed video miles, Nauto’s machine learning algorithms continuously improve and impact driver behavior before events happen, not after. Nauto has enabled the largest commercial fleets in the world to avoid more than 25,000 collisions, resulting in nearly $100 million in savings.

Nauto is located in North America, Japan, and Europe. Nauto is backed by SoftBank Vision FundGroup Corp., Greylock Partners, BMW iVentures, General Motors Ventures, Toyota AI Ventures, Allianz Group, Playground Global and DNX Ventures.

Responsibilities

As a member of our Device Engineering team, you will be responsible for development of Java and Native (C++) Applications for Android as well as Linux Applications for the Nauto device platforms.
Your will be interacting with product managers to scope platform features, advise them on feasibility, provide estimations.
You will be working with hardware engineers to create Applications for the hardware being designed with hardware and deliver functionality for the platform.
You will own the delivery of your code from end-to-end, automating continuous integration and delivery.

Skills

You are self-motivated and driven with solid programming as well as Architecture and Design skills for delivering applications for embedded platforms
You have strong Android as well as Linux Application development skills.
7+ years excelling in software engineering roles with track record of successful delivery of production quality software for embedded and user facing mobile applications
BS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or relevant technical field required, MS/PhD a plus
Strong experience in working with various sensors (IMU, camera, GPS, etc.) and implementing complex algorithms
Track record in published apps in Play store a big plus
Experience in computer vision and/or deep learning algorithms a plus

Perks

Ground floor opportunity with the team; shape the strategic direction of the company.
Beautiful modern workspace. Many perks including a cafe with meals, snacks, and drinks provided.
Exceptional health benefits coverage.
Opportunities to get to know your team better through frequent employee events and gatherings.
Sharp, motivated co-workers in a fun office environment.
Learning and development opportunities from a highly diverse and talented peer group, including experts in a wide range of fields, from Artificial Intelligence & Computer Vision to Systems & Device Engineering to Support & Operations.

Come revolutionize transportation safety and do your best work here at Nauto!

Nauto is committed to being a diverse and inclusive environment that fosters learning from each other. We celebrate people of diverse backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to providing a work environment free of harassment and discrimination.

To all recruitment agencies: Nauto does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Nauto employees or any other company location. Nauto is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Job Summary:

Manage administration of incentive compensation plans across multiple plans and regions.
Assist with monthly and quarterly analyses to measure compensation plan performance.

Validate Sales Compensation payouts and ensure they align to plan design.
Facilitate onboarding of sales person with respect to explaining to the new hire the administration process, plan construct and associated system set up.

Proficiency working within sales compensation administration systems (examples: Xactly (Preferred), CallidusCloud, Oracle Incentive Compensation, IBM SPM)

Strong verbal and written communication skills. Must be able to present efficiently and effectively to various levels of management.

Previous experience with setting up sales compensation systems will be an definite advantage.

We are building the most advanced SoC's in the world for these applications and are looking for SoC architects to join our effort. In this position, you will have the opportunity to work with teams to maximize the potential of our SoC products, bringing together NVIDIA GPUs, custom processors and accelerators under the most extreme of conditions. Your role will be cross disciplinary, collaborating with other architects, software, ASIC design, verification, and platform teams. Our SoC architects excel at pushing the state of the art, while making the best engineering trade-offs.
What you’ll be doing:
Build and use architectural modeling tools to drive hardware architecture decisions
Work with product development teams to optimize application performance, taking advantage of diverse SoC hardware resources
Profile and debug SoC application performance, tracing through complex application/driver/OS software stacks
Model and debug SoC hardware performance pre and post-silicon
Model performance, perf@watt, and perf/area, and analyze tradeoffs throughout the design process
What we need to see:
You have a MS or PhD degree in computer or electrical engineering or equivalent work experience
At least 10+ years of architecture and/or software development experience, mapping applications to complex SoC hardware
Very strong software development skills (in C++) and a deep knowledge of OS/driver software stacks, e.g., Linux/QNX
You are comfortable communicating and solving issues at different levels from micro-architecture to system and software architecture
Excellent analytical, written, and verbal interpersonal skills and ability to work as part of a global team
Ways to stand out from the crowd:
Additional software skills such as Driver/OS development, Real time software development and SystemC modeling
Deep learning model development

LinQuest is seeking a Senior Software Architect to join our team at our office in Colorado Springs, Colorado.
The LinQuest JADC2 team is looking for talented and motivated engineers to advance the state of the art of Joint All Domain Command and Control (JADC2) through the development of advanced modeling and simulation, data analytics, and visualization capabilities for training and operational command and control solutions.
As a Senior Software Architect, you will join a fast-paced agile team to assemble large-scale enterprise, open-architecture cloud-based applications combining real and simulated data and services, and applying artificial intelligence/machine learning techniques, to plan, coordinate and monitor operations across the air, space, surface, subsurface, and cyber warfighting domains. Engineers on this interdisciplinary team collaborate to deliver a complete capability from concept development to deployment.
The Senior Software Architect will lead an interdisciplinary team to define and implement Joint All Domain Command and Control (JADC2) modeling and simulation, and visualization capabilities to support advanced space training and operational command and control. Tasking includes concept development, technology selection, project planning, system architecting and design, data modeling, user interface development, and application programming interface development. The successful candidate will have a strong background in space modeling and simulation and training.
Duties and Responsibilities:
Lead a cross functional agile team to develop a high fidelity space C2 training capability that integrates modeling and simulation capabilities to provide visibility into on-orbit assets and effects, ground-based assets and effects, and communication links and effects.
Support the Business Development team solution development, define software architectures and develop prototypes to support JADC2 related opportunities and next generation Department of Defense Air, Space, Cyber, Maritime, and Ground capabilities.
Develop project plans and schedules
Collaborate with systems engineers and subject matter experts to refine requirements
Develop and review system and subsystem architectural designs, software implementation, integration and testing of architectural components, data management, applications interfaces, communications/messaging protocols and technology assessments and trade studies.
Select and implement technologies to modernize the system architecture
Perform software design and development in C#, Java, Python and SQL
Support test execution, troubleshooting, and defect resolution
Review and assess designs for compliance with computer/network security best practices
Required Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in software engineering, computer science, or related discipline
10 years of experience in software engineering
Experience leading an agile software development team
Experience designing and integrating applications using modern design patterns and frameworks
Experience with C#, Java, C++ and/or Python development in a mixed Windows/Linux environment
Experience developing distributed, cloud-native applications and services using Big Data technologies (e.g., Spark, Kafka) and SQL and/or NoSQL databases in a commercial cloud environment such as AWS or Azure
Experience with DevSecOps pipeline processes and tools
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
US Citizenship and an active DoD TS/SCI Security Clearance is required to be considered for this position

Master’s degree in software engineering, computer science, or related discipline.
Experience developing space and electronic warfare modeling and simulation software
Experience with Distributed Interactive Simulation (DIS) and/or High Level Architecture (HLA)
Experience developing DoD training systems.

Corporate Finance Senior Analyst

Introduction

Be a Part of the Technology Revolution

There has never been a more exciting time to be part of a technology company such as Visteon. And no industry offers more fast-paced change and opportunity than today’s automotive industry. We are in the midst of a mobility revolution that will completely change the way we interact with our vehicles, reduce the number of car accidents and fatalities, and make the world a cleaner place.

Visteon is at the epicenter of this mobility revolution. Two major trends in the automotive industry – the shift to electric vehicles and vehicles with autonomous safety technologies – have created unique opportunities for Visteon. We are the only automotive provider focused exclusively on cockpit electronics – the fastest-growing segment in the industry. We’re participating in this new era of technology in the same place we’ve always been – the fast lane.

The Role

The Corporate Finance Senior Analyst will play a key role in developing all internal and external financial communications for the Director of Corporate Finance, CFO, and CEO. This role will also support activities related to investor relations, corporate development, and strategic planning.

Responsibilities

Prepare all external investor presentations, including quarterly and annual earnings releases, investor conferences, and non-deal roadshows
Prepare business update slides for Board of Director meetings including information on industry developments, peer information, financial performance, and financial forecasts
Prepare monthly CFO presentation for executive committee meeting
Support and prepare all other internal and external financial presentations for the Director of Corporate Finance, CFO, and CEO
Track published analyst notes and financial models to keep senior management updated on Wall Street earnings estimates and opinions of Visteon; includes reconciliation of analyst estimates and expectations versus internal forecast
Assist with the ongoing refinement of key messaging and market positioning based on company performance, market perception, expectations, peer performance and relative valuation
Develop detailed financial models working with cross functional departments, including 5-year business plan (3-statement financial model), downturn scenario models, and detailed operating plant models
Support M&A and investment opportunities through analysis and due diligence, including financial modeling and valuation
Support CFO and CEO on ad-hoc analysis
Conduct peer analysis including peer bench-marking studies

Requirements

Top-tier academic background
Experience in a mix of investor relations, investment banking, private equity/venture capital, consulting, transaction services, and/or corporate development, with ability to demonstrate exceptional strategic thinking
Mastery of PowerPoint and Excel including the ability to create PPT templates, external presentations, and complex 3-statement financial models while being able to navigate both systems via shortcut keys
Ability to effectively build relationships with internal and external partners
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to analyze the audience and develop the appropriate message
Strong analytical skills with extensive valuation/financial modeling experience
Lifetime learner with a passion for developing both professional and personally
Strong attention to detail

More Good Reasons to Work for Visteon

Focusing on the Future

Our company strategy focuses on emerging areas of the automotive industry, including autonomous vehicles. This strategy is driven by constant innovation, and you will support our efforts through your role. We are recognized across the industry for innovation. We have a strong book of business that is expected to drive future growth, along with a customer base that includes almost every automotive manufacturer in the world.

Company Culture

Working at Visteon is a journey in which our employees can develop their strengths and advance their careers while making a difference globally. If you’re looking for an opportunity that will change the world and how we interact with vehicles, join us. Visteon is where the best technical talent creates the future. Learn more about our culture here.

Competitive Compensation and Benefits

Visteon offers competitive salaries and benefits and an environment that encourages employees to achieve their career goals.

About Visteon

Visteon is a global technology company that designs, engineers and manufactures innovative cockpit electronics and connected car solutions for the world’s major vehicle manufacturers. Visteon is driving the smart, learning, digital cockpit of the future, to improve safety and the user experience. Visteon is a global leader in cockpit electronic products including digital instrument clusters, information displays, infotainment, head-up displays, telematics, SmartCore™ cockpit domain controllers, and the DriveCore™ autonomous driving platform. Visteon also delivers artificial intelligence-based technologies, connected car, cybersecurity, interior sensing, embedded multimedia and smartphone connectivity software solutions. Headquartered in Van Buren Township, Michigan, Visteon has approximately 10,000 employees at more than 40 facilities in 18 countries. Visteon had sales of approximately $3 billion in 2018. Learn more at www.visteon.com.

Follow Us

For more information about our company, technologies, and products, follow us on LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook, YouTube and Instagram. Additionally, you can follow our careers-focused channels on Twitter and Facebook to keep up with our latest job postings and the great work our employees are doing.

job_title_2: Senior Embedded Software Engineer - Custom Products
job_description:
If you are a current Motorola Solutions employee, please click this link to apply through your Workday account.
Company Overview
At Motorola Solutions, we create technologies our customers refer to as their lifeline. Our technology platforms in communications, software, video and services help our customers work safely and more efficiently. Whether it’s helping firefighters see through smoke, enabling police officers to see around street corners, or reliably keeping the lights on in homes and businesses around the world, our work supports those who put their lives on the line to keep us safe. Bring your passion, potential and talents to Motorola Solutions, and help us usher in a new era in public safety and security.

Department Overview
The Applied Technology organization puts some of Motorola Solutions' brightest minds on unique, highly challenging projects. Based on decades of experience with our customers, we apply leading-edge technologies to support security and safety throughout the world. We engineer our products from start to finish and manufacture them in-house. We're known for low volume and high capability with focused specialization in areas including software-defined radios, advanced antenna solutions, artificial intelligence and machine learning, cybersecurity, signals intelligence and more. We can't tell you much more about what we do, but we can tell you it's amazing.

Job Description
Candidates for this position are software engineers with strong embedded programming skills who demonstrate curiosity, continuous learning, and an ability to adapt. Ideal candidates have a diverse knowledge and a wide variety of interests, especially in wireless communications. Hands-on experience in embedded software development is also beneficial. Our products are developed to very high standards of quality and reliability and you will be expected to learn and conform to the department’s software process during all development activities. You will have the opportunity to create proof-of-concept and low-volume specialty communications products for government and private industry.
Responsibilities:
Develop solutions for real world systems and standalone products to enhance existing Applied Technology offerings.
Collaborate with multi-disciplinary product development teams.
Perform duties in all areas of development (i.e. requirements analysis, high and low-level design, coding, model training and evaluation, documentation, real world testing, and validation).
Hands-on interaction with product hardware for developing and debugging.

Specific Skills/Knowledge:
Excellent understanding of real-time embedded software design and be proficient in Linux, C, C++, Python and other software languages and operating systems.
Agile software development and/or Git/JIRA experience is a plus.
Flexible, results-oriented problem-solver who requires minimal supervision. Projects can vary greatly from one to the next, so you must thrive on variety and enjoy taking on new challenges.
Ability to meaningfully communicate with members of all engineering disciplines (Hardware, RF, Software, FPGA, etc), as well as management.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Experience Developing software for wireless communications products a plus

Basic Requirements
Bachelor's (BS) or Master's (MS) degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or related technical field.
Experience programming in C, C++, and/or Python
Must be a U.S. citizen with ability to obtain necessary security clearance as required by government contract. Some contracts may have higher-level clearance requirements.

Travel Requirements
None

Relocation Provided
None

Position Type
Experienced

Referral Payment Plan
Yes


EEO Statement
Motorola Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran's status, or, any other protected characteristic.

Senior Image Processing Engineer
United States Citizenship Required
At Expedition Technology, we push the boundaries of what is possible every day. Our engineers excel in tackling traditional signal processing problems and creating novel solutions using machine learning/deep learning algorithms. We are one of a very few companies that has been successful in employing deep learning to traditional signal processing. Our collaborative culture is conducive to researching and developing the cutting-edge solutions our DOD and IC customers seek.
We are currently seeking like-minded engineers and developers to join our growing team.
As an engineer and technologist in image processing, machine learning, and/or computer vision with our team, you will be working with our clients to design, create, evaluate, and maintain solutions using your experience and expertise in image processing, machine learning, computer vision and data science.
In your role you will work with various teams to research, develop, and deploy machine/deep learning solutions for national security missions spanning satellite, space, radio frequency and imaging systems. Your work will be instrumental in transforming the way intelligence communities handle and analyze information and translate it into actionable intelligence.
You will join Expedition Technology at a very exciting time as we continue to grow our software and signal processing capabilities. Today our team consists of developers, scientists, engineers, researchers, and analysts that have served federal, state, and local government clients on high-consequence problems in analytics, AI/machine learning and signal processing.
We are engaged in programs across the Department of Defense and the Intelligence Community and have been instrumental in making our customers' programs successful in ways they never imagined.
Required Qualifications
US Citizenship – must be able to obtain and maintain a US Government issued security clearance of Top Secret or higher. Only US citizens are eligible.
BA/BS in a technology, engineering, computer science or related discipline
At least 5 years of hands-on experience in one or more of the fields of image processing, machine learning, computer vision, and data science
Hands-on experience of a broad ranges of technology systems and ability to work with:
A range of image processing and computer vision frameworks and libraries
Any of the following AI/machine learning frameworks, statistical packages, and libraries: Tensorflow, Caffe, Amazon Machine Learning, Apache Singa, Torch, Scikit-learn, Microsoft CNTK, Apache Mahout, SQL, d3.js, map-reduce, R, Weka, Orange, as well as open source and other emerging technologies/frameworks
A range of programming languages and scripting methods including: Python, C, C++, Java, .NET, Bash, AWK (need not know all)
Preference for using Linux (Ubuntu) over Windows
Experience conducting (and/or leading) research and development of SIGINT, RF and advanced Image Processing systems
Experience with developing alternate concepts of operation to improve image quality, including automated image quality assessment, image enhancement, device calibration
Ability to develop software algorithms to assess and improve image quality
A strong desire to work in an agile and cross functional team environment, understand team goals and generate appropriate, innovative analytical insights to drive process and experience improvement
You are someone who thrives on challenging the status quo, is hungry to explore, evaluate, and understand new technologies, and wishes to share insights and mentor your peers
The ability to qualify for a US Government-issued Top-Secret Clearance –
US Citizenship is REQUIRED in order to obtain the proper level of clearance
Desired Qualifications
Advanced degree with a MS/PhD specializing in data science, computer vision, machine learning, and artificial intelligence
Exemplary written and verbal communication skills (e.g., technical writing)
Experience working with DOD and IC clients, operational components, and stakeholders
People who enjoy solving problems, and who are comfortable with ambiguity
The ability to self-manage, with strong self-organization skills, and eagerness to contribute
Consuming desire to be an excellent engineer, eager to explore new technologies, and develop new skills
Active TS/SCI strongly desired
Expedition Technology (EXP) is an employee-owned defense and aerospace technology small business that has become a market leader in developing software applications running advanced machine learning algorithms for the DOD and Intelligence Communities. We offer a collaborative team-based culture, a people-first mentality and a focus on cutting edge solutions.
We offer self-directed, company-paid, medical, dental and vision benefits. Additionally, our team enjoys a 401k with up to 12% company match, equity shares, paid holidays, paid time off, tuition reimbursement programs and a student loan repayment option. Most importantly, we offer an environment where we are encouraged to push boundaries, take risks and enjoy the rewards.
EXP is proud that our dynamic and collaborative culture along with our generous benefits package allowed us to earn a spot on the 2019 and the 2020 Washington Business Journal's Best Places to Work List.
If you are interested in seeing for yourself why our employees' voices made us a Best Place to Work, we'd love to talk with you.
EXP is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer that believes a diverse range of talent creates an environment that fuels creativity and innovation. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, national origin, genetic information or protected veteran status.
4fu58QA1OP

Business Group Highlights

Intelligence

The Intelligence group provides high-end systems engineering and integration products and services, data analytics and software development to national and military intelligence customers. Serving federal agencies and the Intelligence Community for more than 50 years, the Intelligence group helps our clients meet their mission needs by providing trusted advisors, leading-edge technologies, and innovative solutions.

Responsibilities

Expert Systems Engineer in leading the charge by taking a multi-discipline approach to resiliency requirements engineering, developing resiliency solutions engineering, scheduling, reliability, services development, integration, resiliency test and evaluation, maintainability and analysis across the National System of Geospatial-intelligence (NSG), Allied System of Geospatial-intelligence (ASG) and Federal Agencies to ensure GEOINT resiliency needs.

Duties include:

Assists the Government in supporting GEOINT resiliency day-to-day tasks as required in the review, development, generation, and vetting of program and NGA studies/trades/plans and/or documents including: operational and functional requirements, system context diagrams, Concepts of Operations (CONOPS), Interface Control Documents (ICDs), Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) development and process implementation Requests for Change (RFC) etc.
Assists the Government in directing requirements engineering, solutions engineering, scheduling, reliability, resiliency, services development, integration, test and evaluation, maintainability and analysis across the National System of Geospatial-intelligence (NSG), Allied System of Geospatial-intelligence (ASG) and Federal Agencies.
Assists with the evaluation of proposed changes, impacts, technical architectures and documentation, e.g. Rough Order of Magnitude (ROMs), Resilience Plans and Continuity of Operations (COOP) planning documentation.
Assist with plans, develops reference architectures, implementation plans, exercise plans, data strategies, and process flows for impacts to COOP/Resiliency and GEOINT Resilient Operations. Identify and apply “lessons learned” across supported NGA projects, as applicable
Assist the Government in the refinement of customer understanding of Mission Essential Functions (MEF) and Mission areas to drive priorities and analysis of resiliency positions
Participate in NGA, Mission Partner and Development Contractor Integrated Product Teams (IPTs) and working groups to support, develop, and update program business plans, advocacy briefings, and program schedules as required.
Assist with the facilitation of government meetings, seminars, meeting invitation, tracking, documentation, and notes, appropriate media /document security.
Contribute Agency, Command, or Corporate level organization, and Major System Acquisition resiliency-to-requirements documentation/management expertise towards system and risk management to Mission Assurance/Resiliency program activities.
Provide system security oversight for multiple sites and systems; and recommend, implement, maintain, and review security documents and policies, in support of current DoD and ODNI C&A /A&A requirements
Evaluate, coordinate, and participate in GEOINT Resiliency and Mission Assurance plans and exercises.
Supports the analyses and allocation of requirements to systems architecture components and executing programs.
Assist the Government in the execution of the Mission Thread Analysis (MTA), identifying the tools, systems and needs required for the Resiliency Prioritization Framework.
Assist in leading Analysis of Alternatives (AoAs), Course of Actions (CoAs), Trade Studies, and Engineering Assessments related to NGA’s Resiliency Capabilities.
Assists the Government in strategic technical planning, project management, performance engineering, risk management and interface design.
Provides administrative assistance to NOC/Mission Assurance for the execution of the administrative notification messages (SENS, M3, and System Agents) in support of the POETRY SOP.
Provides expert advice to the Government in the areas of relating vision, strategy, plans, needs, requirements, and process and capability developments.
Demonstrated knowledge of the current NSG/ASG and NRO enterprises.
Oversees and assist in the coordination of work of Senior-, Mid-, and Junior-level contractor Systems Engineers within the GEOINT Resiliency Team (GRT).
Qualifications

Required:

Master’s degree in Systems Engineering or in related technical or scientific fields such as engineering, physics, mathematics, operations research, engineering management, Computer Resources Information Management, Information Systems, or related STEM degree program.
Expert level working experience in government or industry in relevant work areas including: DoD/IC Acquisition Process, Requirements Process, NGA Production and Dissemination, IC TCPED or system engineering of large complex System of Systems or Service Oriented Architecture/Cloud environments.
Experience working agency level Resiliency activities
Experience with and strong understanding of systems engineering lifecycle.

Desired:

Extensive working knowledge of Model Based Systems Engineering, processes, tools and languages.
Working knowledge of Software Development Frameworks.
Extensive work experience in the field of geospatial intelligence.
Experience engineering solutions using Cloud-based technologies.
Experience architecting solutions using Automation, Artificial Intelligence, and Augmentation technologies.
Demonstrated knowledge of the current NSG/ASG and NRO enterprises
Demonstrated expertise in photogrammetry, remote sensing, image science, information sciences, geographic information systems, geomatics, or related fields.
